Reason: The 'bucket.size' configuration is performance-sensitive. This is because the size of the buckets directly impacts the rendering process, affecting the number of buckets created and ultimately the rendering quality. Depending on the size set, it can either reduce the number of buckets and potentially degrade rendering quality or increase the number of buckets and potentially improve rendering quality. This directly affects the performance of the system as it involves time-expensive operations related to rendering. Therefore, the 'bucket.size' configuration can lead to notable performance variations at the system level.
